results.title: Getting a handle on stress with Heidi Di Santo
results.brief_description: Stress is a part of most people’s lives and can be traced back to the fight or flight instincts in prehistoric days. Today this problem is confounded by the fact that we are not as reliant on the fight or flight mechanism, and the societal pressures that contribute to stress levels. This program covers areas such as the effects of long term stress, telltale signs that you are suffering from stress, the importance of identifying how you individually react to stress. It also interviews people who have suffered from serious stress and how it has affected their lifestyle, as well as covering the areas of relaxation, disassociation, sleep, exercise, diet, and the dynamic relationship between thought, feeling and reaction. The video is designed to be integrated with the teachers guide and participant workbooks (available as a separate loan item), as part of a 2-4 hour training session on handling stress.

results.title: Get us kids out of here (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A study of the context in which young people offend and some of the offences that they commit. The program is introduced by Laurie Taylor, Professor of Sociology at the University of York, and it includes contributions from a wide range of specialists in the subject, as well as the case histories of several young offenders.

results.title: Get rid of rats
results.brief_description: Rats are the destroyers of millions of dollars worth of food each year, as well as carriers of dangerous diseases against which scientists war constantly. The city dump, breeding and feeding ground from which the rats spread through towns and villages, must be replaced with modern garbage disposal techniques. The rat-proofing of cellars and storage buildings must be done with intelligence and common sense to match rat strength and cunning. Only by depriving them of food and shelter can man eliminate these filthy disease-carriers.

results.title: Get help - give aid
results.creator_credit: Paul Fillinger, American College of Emergency Physicians and Fillinger Films
results.brief_description: Gives us an overview of what first aid to provide in a variety of emergency situations. Shows how to use the phone to contact emergency services; how to stop the flow of blood; how to give mouth-to-mouth resuscitation; how to help a person whose clothes are on fire and how to give aid to a person who is choking. NB THE PROCEDURE FOR FIRST AID FOR CHOKING IS NOT THE PROCEDURE RECOMMENDED IN AUSTRALIA.

results.title: Get a job
results.creator_credit: Brad Caslor, Derek Mazur, Michael Scott and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An animated short film that follows the tribulations of a cartoon character, Bob Dog, as he hunts for a job. Self-motivation, preparing a resume, contacting people by phone and mail, getting ready for an interview and the interview itself—all are dealt with in a highly entertaining fashion. The Motown mover Get a Job provides the upbeat musical sound track.

results.title: Gestures (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The Story - Fifteen year old Jessica is partially deaf. When her hearing parents leave on an overseas trip, Jessica is left in the care of her profoundly deaf grandmother, with whom she has difficulty communicating. Embarrassed by her own hearing impairment, Jessica now finds herself caught between two worlds, belonging to neither. The Company - Gestures Theatre-of-the -Deaf comprises 14 deaf actors under the direction of Sarah Werfel (hearing) and Leonora Martin (profoundly deaf). The company devises plays based on events of importance to the deaf community. These plays are performed in mime and an Australian sign language (Auslan) for both deaf and hearing audiences.

results.title: Gertrude Stein and a companion
results.brief_description: This film is a compelling exploration of the 40 year tempestuous relationship between the legendary American writer and lecturer, Gertrude Stein, and her beloved companion, Alice B. Toklas. Based entirely on historical materials and the personal letters of Toklas, it provides an intimate portrait of these two unique and unconventional women. Stein’s thoughts on Alice, the arts, America’s Hemingway and other characters are revealed. Scenes from their public and private lives are interwoven with Alice’s recollections of their time together.

results.title: Germany: Feudal states to unification
results.brief_description: Traces Prussia’s growth in strength in the nineteenth century. Shows how other German states were brought under its control and how the wars with Denmark, Austria and France were fought.

results.title: Gerald Mcboing boing (K)
results.creator_credit: Robert Cannon, Stephen Bosustow, Bosustow Entertainment and United Productions of America
results.brief_description: At first, young Gerald’s boings, honks, beeps, toots and train whistle noises nearly drive his parents crazy - and when time and even school fail to teach him to actually talk like other children, the situation grows bleaker. Rejected by his peers, an outcast in a world of words, the friendless Gerald runs away from home. Then from a dark and dreadful snowstorm he is rescued by the owner of a radio station who needs just such a lad for his sound effects department. At last Gerald has found his niche. From the story by Dr Seuss, adapted by Bill Scott and Phil Eastman and narrated by Marvin Miller. Animation by Bill Melendez, Rudy Larriva, Pat Matthews, Willis Pyle, Frank Smith. Suitable for primary school level.
